sen.j: 平 真樹（たいらの まき/まさき 生没年未詳）は、平安時代中期の荘園領主・豪族である。
sen.e: TAIRA no Maki (the date of birth and death unknown) is a lord of the manor and Gozoku (local ruling family) in mid Heian period.
TAIRA no Maki (the date of birth and death unknown) was a lord of the manor from a local ruling family during mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 過去の事実なので過去形にしました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Maki (the date of birth and death unknown) was a lord of the manor from a local ruling family during mid Heian period.

sen.j: 常陸国、新治郡の土豪であったとされる。
sen.e: He is said to be a local clan of Nihari county, Hitachi province.
He is said to be a local clan of Nihari county, Hitachi province.
He is said to be a local clan of Nihari county, Hitachi province.

sen.j: 平氏の姓を冠しているが、同地域の平高望系の平氏としては確認できない。
sen.e: His family name is that of the Taira clan but he cannot be confirmed to be in line of the Taira clan of TAIRA no Takamochi who is from the same area.
He had 'Taira' of the Taira clan as his family name but he cannot be confirmed to be in line of a Taira clan originated from TAIRA no Takamochi, who was from the same area.
sen.cmt: 「平高望系の平氏」は平高望から派生した一平氏と考え変えました。
sen.e: He had 'Taira' of the Taira clan as his family name but he cannot be confirmed to be in line of a Taira clan originated from TAIRA no Takamochi, who was from the same area.

sen.j: 平将門にとっては「強力な同盟者」という評価があり、真樹の娘は将門の妻（君の御前）として嫁いだとされている。
sen.e: For Taira no Masakado, he had a reputation of a 'strong ally' and Maki's daughter married Masakado (in front of the emperor).
For Taira no Masakado, he had a reputation of a 'strong ally' and Maki's daughter married Masakado (in front of the emperor).
Taira no Masakado praised him as a 'strong ally' and Maki's daughter (known as Kiminogozen) married Masakado.
sen.cmt: 君の御前は真樹の娘の名前です。

sen.j: 新治郡にある大国玉に住む領主で、真壁・新治・筑波の広い範囲に領地を保有していたといわれる。
sen.e: He was a feudal lord who lived in Ookunitama, Nihari county and he is said to have owned territories in a vast area, from Makabe, Nihari, to Tsukuba.
He was a feudal lord who lived in Ookunitama, Nihari county and he is said to have owned vast territories from Makabe, Nihari, to Tsukuba.
sen.cmt: 「広い地域の領土」を簡単にまとめました。
sen.e: He was a feudal lord who lived in Ookunitama, Nihari county and he is said to have owned vast territories from Makabe, Nihari, to Tsukuba.

sen.j: 源護との土地を巡る確執から、度々争っていた。
sen.e: He often fought with MINAMOTO no Mamoru, as there was feud between them.
He often fought with MINAMOTO no Mamoru, as there was feud over the territory between them.
sen.cmt: 「土地を巡る」が訳抜けだったので加えました。
sen.e: He often fought with MINAMOTO no Mamoru, as there was feud over the territory between them.

sen.j: 真樹は将門に調停を頼み将門はそれを受け援護した。
sen.e: Asked by Maki to arbitrate, Masakado backed him up. (He is said to have accepted reluctantly as should TAIRA no Maki be defeated by MINAMOTO no Mamoru, there is a high possibility that his territory be put under risk)
Asked by Maki to arbitrate, Masakado backed him up. (He is said to have accepted reluctantly because he might lose his own territoty if TAIRA no Maki should be defeated by MINAMOTO no Mamoru).
sen.cmt: 「自らの領地が危うくなる」は、「領地を失う」と考えてput under riskからloseにしました。
sen.e: Asked by Maki to arbitrate, Masakado backed him up.

sen.j: （平真樹が源護に敗れてしまうと今度は自らの領地が危うくなる可能性が高いので、しぶしぶ承知したといわれる。）
sen.e: (He is said to have accepted reluctantly because he might lose his own territoty if TAIRA no Maki should be defeated by MINAMOTO no Mamoru).

sen.j: これにより将門は護と対立を強め、また護と姻戚関係である伯父平国香らが護側の味方であった為、元々因縁があったらしい伯父らと更に深く対立する事となってしまった。
sen.e: For this reason, conflict between Masakado and Mamoru became stronger and since his uncle, TAIRA no Kunika, who had a matrimonial relation with Mamoru, was in favor of Mamoru's side, conflict between his uncle etc., with whom is said to have had confrontation with him to start with, became even stronger.

For this reason, the conflict between Masakado and Mamoru became more serious and so did the one between Maki and his uncle, TAIRA no Kunika, who Maki were not on good terms with and who was in favor of Mamoru's side with a matrimonial relation with Mamoru.
sen.cmt: 「対立が強まる」「対立が深まる」をconflictとseriousにしました。又、関係詞がいくつかあって修飾関係がわかりにくいと思ったのでまとめました。
sen.e: For this reason, the conflict between Masakado and Mamoru became more serious and so did the one between Maki and his uncle, TAIRA no Kunika, who Maki were not on good terms with and who was in favor of Mamoru's side with a matrimonial relation with Mamoru.

sen.j: そしてついには、護の子である源扶・源隆・源繁らが将門を襲撃する事となり、将門と一族の争いは益々激しさを増していくこととなる。
sen.e: At last, Mamoru's children, MINAMOTO no Tasuku, MINAMOTO no Takashi, and MINAMOTO no Shigeru, attacked Masakado and the fight between Masakado and the family became fierce.
At last, Mamoru's children, MINAMOTO no Tasuku, MINAMOTO no Takashi, and MINAMOTO no Shigeru, attacked Masakado and the fight between Masakado and the family became fierce.
At last, Mamoru's children, MINAMOTO no Tasuku, MINAMOTO no Takashi, and MINAMOTO no Shigeru, attacked Masakado and the fight between Masakado and the family became fierce.

sen.j: 承平 (日本)6年（936年）、護は朝廷に将門と真樹についての告状を提出し、朝廷はこれにもとづいて真樹らに召喚の官符を発したが、承平7年（937年）4月7日の朱雀天皇元服の大赦によって全ての罪を赦され、後の承平7年（937年）9月23日、将門と共に弓袋山で平良兼と戦った。
sen.e: In 936, Mamoru submitted a complaint regarding Masakado and Makito to the Imperial Court who issued a kanpu (official documents from Dajokan) based on the complaint, calling for Maki etc., but he was forgiven from all sins as Emperor Suzaku granted an amnesty on April 7, 937 and on September 23, 937, he fought against TAIRA no Yoshikane with Masakado.

In 936, Mamoru submitted a complaint regarding Masakado and Makito to the Imperial Court, who issued a kanpu (official documents from Dajokan) to call for Maki and so on based on the complaint, but he was forgiven for all sins as Emperor Suzaku granted an amnesty on May 24, 937 and on September 23, 937, he and Masakado fought against TAIRA no Yoshikane in Mt. Yubukuro-yama.
sen.cmt: 日付をグレゴリウス暦に変えました。また「弓袋山」が訳抜けだったので加えました。

sen.j: 平真樹が治めた荘園の中心地付近には、大国玉神社があり、館跡があったという。
sen.e: Near the central of the private estate where TAIRA no Maki ruled, there was Ookunitama Jinja Shrine as well as the remains.
It is said that there were Okunitama Jinja Shrine and the remains of his residence near the central of the private estate which TAIRA no Maki ruled.
